Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: STroek
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and clean rooms. Superb beds as well! Best sleep in a long while. Try the free sauna&wellness. Fitness-room was well enough equipped as well. Great value for money. A bit out the touristic centre but with a short ride on tram M4, you'll get there shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value-for-money in quiet residential area”
Reviews.Author: andrelot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lucky last-minute offer we managed to book in Berlin. It is located in a quiet residential area, close to a park, close to a supermarket (where you can buy food to cook in the well-equipped mini-kitchen). Rooms are comfortable, very clean, and so is the bathroom. On the fridge there is water offered for free. Internet access is free for one hour per day, though I had trouble making it work in my iPhone. The only drawback: the car parking garage is too narrow, and requires some tricky maneuvering when full. The parking spots themselves are of good size, but they have those movable rails for extra cars to be parked over, which means you might have to shift them around. This hotel is really an option I wish I had discovered earlier in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: chrischan_rj_
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a great price! This hotel is not in the center of Berlim, but the neighborhood is nice and quiet. And taking M4 tram, that pass very near the hotel,it's only 10 minutes to Alexanderplatz. The rooms are huge.They have a microwave, fridge/freezer, safe, bath and free wi-fi. The breakfast its not so cheap but it's also great with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine and cheap hotel!”
Reviews.Author: karlzzzen86
Reviews.Content: Despite that the hotel is a bit off the city, you can take the tram (5min walk from the hotel) to Alexanders Platz, which takes 10min. The hotel gives you an tranportcard which you can use to every public transportation in Berlin. Nice staff. Next time I travel to Berlin, I will stay at this hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sunil-Globetroter
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a long duration of about 4 weeks and the cost per night was around 72 Eur. The hotel is located little away from AlexanderPlatz and will take about 20 Mins to reach Alexanderpaltz on Tram M4. It has paid internet connection and they charge 150 Eur a month for internet. But the internet is quiet fast. The receptionist and support staff are really helpful and friendly. they have a good restaurant and also the room comes with attaced Kichennete. Iron and Ironing board can be got on request to the front desk. they have a free sauna and gym, the Pool is good and beautiful. The lobby is big and very artistic. the best floor is 3rd floow where u can see the Balacony to the hotel front desk. The Washing machine and Dryer are located in the basement and services of these can be used via coin operated which charge about 5 EUR and 3 Eur. The hotel does provide 2 bottles of water daily as complimentary and the room cleaning si done twice a week. They hotel has a small basement vending machines where u can get soft drinks, chips and chocolates. There is supermarket located about 5 mins by walk to the hotel. All in all the place is fantastic and an ideal place to stay for longer durations. Only issue is that the hotel is little away from city centre and the place gets dark and empty in the nights. all in all a very nice play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NTX4
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel. Good quality breakfast with lots of choices. 2 free bottles of water and 2 free cans of beer per day. Must pay for Internet in the room. Near Weissensee park with running paths. Nice bar in lobby plus beer garden in the back bordering a small park with a pond. Easy walk to a street to take the tram to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Reasonable Handicapped Accessibility”
Reviews.Author: MrScooter
Reviews.Content: We booked via the hotel's web site and got a good rate (approximately 65 Euros per night). I use an electric mobility scooter when traveling, and the hotel lobby was accessible. Our room was on the second floor and accessible via elevator. I had requested a handicapped accessible room. However, the handicapped-accessible rooms are singles (bed for one), so initially they gave my wife and I a regular double. When I complained, they offered us an accessible single room with an adjoining single room for my wife. They don't have any accessible doubles. I explained that we preferred to stay together in the same room, and they agreed to let me have a key to use the accessible bathroom in the other room. I appreciated them coming up with a creative solution to accomodate me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Friendlyrobert
Reviews.Content: - Got 3rd night for free. - Fridge and stove in room. - Free safe in room. - Pleasant small balcony. - Free Laptop access in the lobby was hard to use (Small font could not be adjusted / No mouse / Log in was difficult / Glare from street window). - Neighborhood felt save and was lit at night.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Clean”
Reviews.Author: feedthetraveller
Reviews.Content: Reason for stars: I give it a 4 and not a 5 because I wouldn't consider it a "boutique" hotel. For what it is, I really enjoyed my stay. It had a small kitchenette that was great for fixing up my breakfasts and lunches. Rooms: Great space. The rooms were comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was very clean and spacious. The kitchenette had most of the thing you would need. There was a tv that was small and dated but I wasn't there to watch tv. I got the daily BBC news and that's all I needed. The room also had a balcony which was great for getting a bit of fresh air or for enjoying a coffee. There were 2 computers in the lobby that could be used for a few euros. Location: Relatively close to town (about 15 mins by bus/train, if I remember correctly). There isn't much in the immediate area except for their bar in the lobby. The bar in the lobby attracted locals for a beer while watching the game. The closest market was a block away and they had most groceries. Value: Great. I would go again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel but far away from the action!”
Reviews.Author: Marinmen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Dearg Hotel in Berlin. Although it is not particularly beautiful it doesn't fall short in any sense. Bathrooms and Rooms are very big, there is free internet in the rooms for an hour each day and the staff is polite and helpful although not especially cheerful. The only thing against it is that it is a little bit far from the center of the action, the tram ride is not very long, but it can get packed at times. The real draw back is that the tram stop is 4 longggg blocks away from the hotel in a very quiet residential neighborhood, so once you go back to the hotel it is really hard to muster the evergy to go back out again, (unless you take a cab). So if you are party people this is not in any sense close to ANYTHING at night. If you are the hard core tourist who leaves at 10 AM and returns after a meal in the city this hotel is really good value for money. Beware! the breakfast is not included!!! we thought it was and ended up paying 30 euros a day for it! it is very good anyway so if you are breakfast people it may be worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Out of way, but excellent value”
Reviews.Author: pbaudit
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, with only one glitch. As other reviewers have stated, it is a 15-20 minute tram ride/walk from Alexanderplatz. From Tegel airport, it took about 35-40 minutes (via TXL bus, S41, tram M4). The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk (Antonplatz or Alberinenstr tram stop) in a quiet area near a park and walking trail. There is a Laundry room and Fitness center (older Lifecycle equipment, 1 treadmill, 3 exercise bikes). My room had a balcony, kitchenette (stove, refrigerator, microwave), safe. When I checked in, there was 2 complimentary beers and 2 mineral water. Internet (WiFi) access ranges from 15 mins (2 Euros), 1 hour (4 Euros), 1 day (16 Euros), 1 week (69 Euros). Breakfast is extensive (breads, eggs, cheese, cold cuts, cereal, juices) and is 14 Euros. Portage (Luggage service) is 5 Euro per piece. They are now charging for Travel cards (previous posters indicated that they were complimentary). There is a discount grocery store (Netto) about 5 minutes away. At the intersection of S41 and tram M4 (Greifwalder stop), there is a McDonalds and a couple of large grocery stores, Aldi and Kaiser (A&P). The only glitch was that the hotel charged me for my "complimentary breakfast" (Hotwire reservation). I asked the hotel to check into this, but they said it was not their problem (i.e. Hotwire error).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Grahamwarrior
Reviews.Content: My first stay with the Derag Hotel chain and as I didnt know a lot about them, I was slightly apprehensive. The hotel is about 15 minutes out of town and the easiest way to get to it is by a tram from Alexander platz and then a 5 minute walk. Reception were welcoming and helpful and our room was large, clean, modern and like a mini suite, with a stove, microwave and fridge. The hotel merited its 4 star rating and was about half the price you would pay for a similar room in central Berlin. I strongly recomend it

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the short tram ride out you off - This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: Tajine
Reviews.Content: If you've never been to Berlin before then the short tram ride from Alexanderplatz to the hotel may seem a bit daunting. It takes you thorough a few of the more edgy areas of the city. Don't let that put you off. Once off the tram the hotel is a walk along a tree lined street around 7 minutes walk. I felt pretty safe. The hotel is really nice as it is really close top the Weisensee. The reception was specious with a small bar that opened at odd times, there's also a beer garden. The room was big and spacious with quite luxurious finishings. The bathroom was nice and there's a tiny galley kitchen which is very useful. Note there's a cheap supermarket on the street corner. The room also had a balcony with a table and chairs. There's a utility room in the basement. I would definitely recommedn this place because of the value for money, the proximity to the lake which is great on a sunny day but also because it's close to Alexanderplatz by tram.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Berlin for a good value”
Reviews.Author: mkindred49
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the outskirts of eastern Berlin. It has a very nice and courteous staff and the rooms are very spacious, clean and nice. The only slight negative is that the hotel is located kind of far out from the center. The neighborhood is great: quiet and residential; but it will take you 15 minutes to get to Alexanderplatz on the train/metro. However, the service is frequent and runs all night. We had a standard room with a double bed, deck and kitchenette with a very nice bathroom that included a bidet. The hotel is very quiet and the rooms were cleaned every day. One of the best features of the hotel stay was the morning breakfast buffet: it was excellent. They have a great selection and it was by far the best breakfast (hotel or otherwise) that we had on our trip. It was also nice having a bar in the lobby of the hotel for a drink when you come back after a day of exploring. We would most certainly stay in this hotel again if we come back to Berlin. We really liked it. Our standard room cost us something in the neighborhood of $80/per night and that included breakfast. This was a great hotel and the best place we stayed on our vacation by far.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: welshcowman
Reviews.Content: While being a 17 minute tram (M4 Every 10 minutes) from AlexanderPlatz, and 7 minute walk from AlbertinenSt , the spaciousness , cleanliness, comfort and situation in a quiet suburb of East Berlin close to a lovely park made this an excellent cost effective choice. The staff were helpful, and on checking in we were given a public transport pass that covered all forms of transport in the ABC zones (including our retun to Schonefeld). Breakfast was extensive and varied, including sparkling wine for those who wanted to start the day well. We dined here on our first night, the food was good, but it was made clear that the 10 pm closing time was for food preparation and not ordering. (we entered at 9.35 and were told that we could only have one course). Overall we were very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “High quality, spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BavariaJG
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large because of the separate living area and kitchenette. The value was tremendous because I only paid 82 euros a night. Breakfast was large and very tasty. They even gave us two transportation passes for free for unlimited public transportation use in Berlin for our stay. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Weissensee, a small but busy lake where locals like to swim. It's also only 5 minutes to the nearest tram station (Albertinenstrase). There's a biergarten and a playground for kids less than a hundred feet from the hotel. There's also a small grocery about 3 minutes walk away. I would stay here again definitely, but there were some slight drawbacks. The parking costs 10 euros a night in their underground parking garage. You can park for free on the street, but I could not tell if the neighborhood was "safe" judging from the numerous buildings covered in graffiti. (Come to find out the entire city is covered in graffiti). The restaurant on site "snubbed" me and my family. Reason - more upscale, or so it thinks, so probably didn't take kind to the t-shirts and shorts. At first I was put off but there's a friendly and good German restaurant about a minute's walk away. Finally, if you've never been to Berlin before (first visit) - Weissensee is farther than you think. 5 minutes walk to tram, 15 minutes tram to Alexanderplatz, 20 minutes train to Zoo Berlin. It's easy to do, but it's definitely not quick. If your plan is to "see the sights in your limited time", I would stay closer to Museuminsel.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: JohnScottNorfolk
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a hotel! Situated in a quiet part of town it is a bit of a way out from all the action but the hotel give you a free travel pass for the trams which run 10 minutes away, every five minutes, into the centre. Really nice people, spotless rooms, great breakfast (for Germany!) and you can even cook in the rooms in the miniature kitchen in every room. For best prices, book on line or try e bay!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: 4evergoing
Reviews.Content: Ok rooms, aircondition didn`t work. The staff told us to open the window...Restaurant at the hotel was closed during our stay. Long distance to center. Beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Twettiseek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this very modern, relatively new hotel for 10 days in February 2007. We used a travel Web site (travelnow.com) and paid about $60 a night, which for a 4-star Hotel in Berlin is a tremendous bargain. Included in the price is a free pass for all public transport for the duration of stay. The hotel is no frills, very clean, comfortable, and has very sizeable rooms for a capital. Especially the rooms to the back are dead quiet. Rooms are equipped with a double bed (there are single rooms with single beds at lower rates), couch, armchairs, table, desk, chairs, and TV (about 30 channels). Every room also has a balcony and a kitchenette (fridge, stove, microwave, dishes etc.), which is something we really liked. The bathrooms are good size, clean, and everything looks new. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful. Internet access is only available in the lobby from one computer or, if you bring a laptop, via a wireless card that you have to provide. The location is not ultra central but in the quiet, residential district of Weissensee (White Lake) in the Eastern part of Berlin. Getting to the city center (Mitte) takes 15-20 minutes by car or a bit longer by public transport. The next tram stop towards the center is about an eight-minute walk away. But Berlin is a driving town anyway, and we never go there without renting a (small!) car. The only thing that we didn't like was that there was just 1 pillow per person, and they were very thin/flat. At our request, they brought more pillows. Also there are no irons in the rooms. One either has to use the ironing service or go downstairs to an "ironing room" to iron clothes. Overall, it was an excellent experience, and we will stay there now every time we go back to Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Derag Hotel Koenigin Luise
HotelInfo.Address: Parkstrasse 87, 13086 Berlin, Germany
